datasets.name: quant_neuropath_merged_metadata.csv
datasets.description:
The dataset derives from the Seattle Alzheimer’s Disease Brain Cell Atlas (SEA-AD), which curated a prospective, longitudinally characterised donor cohort deliberately spanning the full continuum of Alzheimer’s pathology. The dataset primarily has labels consisting of donor-ids, biological + spatial markers and metadata fields including Braak stage, Thal phase, CERAD score, dementia diagnosis, APOE genotype, Cognitive Status, and Overall AD neuropathological change. 

Details on biological & spatial markers are attached here. Each QND data entry encodes What (biomarker) × Where (grey matter / cortical layers) × How (area %, count, density, size, co-expression, etc.). All the QND data in this dataset is a permutation over these three axes.

What (Biomarkers):
- AT8 (pTau) – hyper-phosphorylated tau → core neurofibrillary tangles of AD.
- pTDP-43 – phosphorylated TDP-43 → limbic co-pathology that speeds cognitive decline.
- 6E10 (Aβ 1-16) – amyloid-β plaque antibody → canonical early and late Aβ burden.
- aSyn (α-synuclein) – mis-folded α-syn aggregates → Lewy-body co-pathology.
- Iba1 – microglial marker → innate immune activation indexed by morphology.
- GFAP – astrocytic intermediate filaments → reactive gliosis in late-stage injury.
- NeuN – neuronal nuclear protein → census of surviving neurons / loss.
- Hematoxylin – universal nuclear counter-stain → baseline tissue cellularity and QC.

Where (anatomical bins):
- Grey matter – the entire middle-temporal cortical ribbon, used as a global reference.
- Layers 1–4 – individual laminar bins capturing the radial gradient of pathology (L1 = molecular, L2 = external granule, L3 = external pyramidal, L4 = internal granule).
- Layers 5-6 – deep output layers quantified together because the image pipeline cannot always separate them cleanly.


How (measurement affixes):
total … positive area – raw immunoreactive area (µm²).
percent … positive area – fraction of the analyzed bin that is positive (%).
number of … positive cells/objects – count of labeled cells or plaques.
… per area – density normalized to tissue sampled (count · mm⁻²).
average … positive cell/object area – mean size of each labeled entity (µm²).
co-expression / co-localised objects – spatial overlap between two markers (e.g. AT8 + pTDP-43).
process area / process length (Iba1 only) – microglial branching metrics, a proxy for activation.
area analysed – denominator tissue area (µm²) for QC and normalization.
ripa … / guhcl … – biochemical ELISA loads of soluble (RIPA) versus insoluble (guanidine) protein fractions (pg · mg⁻¹ tissue).

raw.name: APOE Genotype
raw.description: APOE genotype of the donor, a genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease.

raw.name: Cognitive Status
raw.description: Cognitive status of the donor, such as 'No dementia' or 'Dementia'.

raw.name: Consensus Clinical Dx (choice=Alzheimers disease)
raw.description: Indicates if the consensus clinical diagnosis includes Alzheimer's disease (Checked or Unchecked).

raw.name: Overall AD neuropathological Change
raw.description: Overall assessment of Alzheimer's disease neuropathological change, categorized as Not AD, Low, Intermediate, or High.

raw.name: Thal
raw.description: Thal phase for amyloid plaque distribution.

raw.name: Braak
raw.description: Braak stage for neurofibrillary tangle distribution.

raw.name: CERAD score
raw.description: CERAD (Consortium to Establish a Registry for Alzheimer's Disease) score for neuritic plaque density.

queries.question: Is there a Braak stage-based difference in AD neuropathological burden among the donors?
